channel.title: CVE Feed for ASUS -- BMC firmware for Z10PR-D16
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ASUS -- BMC firmware for Z10PR-D16

item.title: CVE-2021-28188|2024-09-16T16:22:42.826Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The specific function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page (Modify user’s information function) does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.

item.title: CVE-2021-28177|2024-09-16T19:10:49.934Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The LDAP configuration function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.

item.title: CVE-2021-28187|2024-09-16T17:03:45.222Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The specific function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page (Generate new SSL certificate) does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.

item.title: CVE-2021-28184|2024-09-16T20:31:30.262Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The Active Directory configuration function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.

item.title: CVE-2021-28178|2024-09-16T17:38:58.664Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The UEFI configuration function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.

item.title: CVE-2021-28182|2024-09-16T21:07:24.302Z -- asus -- bmc%20firmware%20for%20z10pr-d16
item.description: The Web Service configuration function in ASUS BMC’s firmware Web management page does not verify the string length entered by users, resulting in a Buffer overflow vulnerability. As obtaining the privileged permission, remote attackers use the leakage to abnormally terminate the Web service.
